POI.info:
Difficulty: Hard
Spawns a single Champion Mushroom King. Ranged HIGHLY recommended
King is very aggressive and will do a mix of rushing at you, pulling you in and slamming his head in the ground.
Red circle = slam (must evade, does big damage), Spin = pull (also important to evade or stun break immediately),
Extra evades, stun breaks, projectile destruction/reflection, and shadowsteps/teleports are very useful to keep him at range. You can also kite him around the mushrooms (arrow) to obstruct the projectiles that pull you in.
Either use Adrenal Mushroom, Health Recovery Food, or have someone else use Jackal pounce on you for the barrier

Next HP is a [Medium-Hard] combat HP with no close respawns. If you want to skip it, go continue from Wanderer's Waypoint
If you are continuing, bamboo is bad, don't hit it.

Difficulty: Medium-Hard
Spawns 1 Veteran Golem and 2 (more if upscaled) normal golems. Ranged Recommended. Summons/pets/minions very helpful for distracting the other golems.
Immediately focus the Veteran...compared to the others, it doesn't have much health, but does a lot of damage. The faster you kill it, the easier the fight.
Once the vet is down, focus the others down one at a time. They are pretty easy to kite around, use the cliffs to your advantage. When you see them get in the punchy stance, use terrain to obstruct their projectiles. Big golems are normal, so CC skills work well on them.
Double dodge

Difficulty: Medium-Hard
Kill all veterans around the sign before starting!
Spawns 1 champion and 2-4 Veteran Warriors. None of them are particularly dangerous alone, there's just a lot to deal with for a solo player. Recommend focusing down any archerers first, then the melee veterans, then the champion. Nothing much else special about this one.

Difficulty: Easy
Summons a champion vinetooth. Ranged recommended. Summons/Pets/Minions help
Kill all bombers before starting
It's pretty easy to kite this guy, just don't stand directly in front of him and continuously loop him around in a circle, staying just off to his side. Otherwise, pretty simple fight.

Difficulty: AFK
Summons a champion Chak Lobber
Equip ranged something. Start HP, immediately get on skyscale. Jump up on rock, sit on arrow. AFK and go put some popcorn in the microwave.

You can stealth commune this if you have access to enough stealth...stealth before going in, wrap around behind fire to arrow, commune
Difficulty: He's an avatar of a god, bro
Jokes aside, he hits really hard and is really annoying for most builds. Kill his dogs first
At 50% HP, unless you stun him by breaking his break bar, he will do a room-wide OHK move. Make sure to use the mushrooms to be on the ledges when he does it.
Other than that, he just does a lot of damage. Try not to get burnt.

Difficulty: AFK
Summons a champion Arrowhead
Equip ranged something. Start HP, immediately get on skyscale. Jump up on rock, sit on arrow. AFK and go get the popcorn you put in the microwave earlier. Snack

Difficulty: Easy
As long as you have some form of sustain over time, you should be able to easily out-sustain his damage. He hits moderately hard, but there's a lot of time in between. Pretty easy fight.

Path 1 is to Balthazar, for most builds he is very hard to solo. You can stealth commune, but you need access to stealth on your class, an ALSK will not work. Or you can call reinforcements from map chat.
Otherwise, take path 2 to TD!
Don't miss unlocking the waypoint!
Make sure to unlock waypoint!
Grab crystal and immediately mount back up

The HP after this is a [Very Hard] difficulty combat HP. If you don't want to do it, you can TP to Teku Nuhoch Waypoint after communing
Otherwise, Interact -> Commune -> Interact with all consoles to open door
This is on a timer, so you have to be somewhat quick

If Rata Novus Waypoint is contested AND you are doing [Very Hard] difficulty combat HPs, waypoint back to Teku Nuhoch Waypoint and come back later, when it isn't contested (make sure you unlocked the waypoint!)
If you aren't planning on doing the combat HP, then you can keep going regardless

Difficulty: Very Hard
Summons a champion Mushroom Queen. Ranged highly recommended.
Mostly, she throws around damaging AoE circles and exploding sporelings. Problem is, it's very tight quarters and you can't lure her out or she will deaggro
If you have multiple people, it gets significantly easier and any squishies can sit on the mushrooms (arrows) to avoid most damage

Difficulty: Medium-Hard
Summons a champion Frawg
Before summoning, kill all the surrounding mobs. If you have decent ranged damage, you can kill many of them from the arrow before dropping down to finish the rest
Once summoned, it is highly recommended to pull the champ to the other arrow, so that you don't get gangbanged when the other enemies respawn
The champ itself isn't too bad, although he is tanky and hits hard. Pets/Summons/Minions are recommended to take aggro. CC is helpful

Ahead is a [Medium-Hard] combat HP. If you want to skip it, just follow the Jade WP trail
Otherwise, place a Jade WP.

Difficulty: Easy or Hard
If you can stack stealth, you can stealth-commune this HP: Drop to Arrow -> Stealth up before getting in range -> Commune -> Run back to arrow or die then wp out. You must stealth yourself before getting close (so no ALSK) otherwise you will get CC'd and wrecked
If no stealth but have ranged: You can kill most of the mobs from the caution sign. DO NOT ATTACK THE KING. He will pull you off the cliff. Kill everything else you can, then kill the king, then commune
If you don't have stealth or ranged...I hope you have lots of stability, stun-breaks and sustain. Preferably kill the little dudes first, then queen, then king. Good luck!
Path 1 (left) leads to a [Easy-Medium] combat HP. If you want to skip it, just go path 2.

Difficulty: Easy-Medium
Summons a champion Troll. Condi Cleanse = Easy fight
Before summoning, kill all nearby trolls or they WILL end up ganking you mid-fight
His basic attacks cause Bleed and it can stack very fast, so having good condi cleanse is the key for this fight. Other than that, he doesn't do much damage, so just wittle him down while managing the bleed stacks

This dive is a bit tight...you're going straight down and then backwards into the cave, through a tight gap, then pulling up hard. If you aren't confident in your griffon skills, recommend placing PPR in case you bonk

Difficulty: Mostly AFK
Summons a champion Spider Queen and Vampire Beasts
Start HP, immediately jump up onto the root and run all the way up to the top arrow
Use ranged to kill the vampire beasts from there. Once dead, move down to the lower arrow and you can literally just autoattack to the spider queen to death. She will occasionally hit you with her poison breath, but it's not a big deal. Practice your golem rotation on her if you want

This dive is also somewhat tight...you're spiraling down aiming for the hole in the ground. It's not a big deal if you bonk though, just make sure you have some speed after going through the hole to reach the next HP

Difficulty: Easy-Medium
Summons a champion Chak Blitzer and 2 normal Chak. Melee required
Before starting, kill all nearby Chak. Be especially wary of the roaming group with a veteran.
The Blitzer herself is not a very big threat. Immediately focus all the small chak. Once alone, just keep yourself behind the Blitzer and she will be unable to hit you with anything. Melee is required because otherwise she will destroy your projectiles and kill you with retaliation
The most important thing is to keep an eye on surrounding chak and make sure you don't get surprised. If any extra mobs get aggro'd, immediately switch focus to them. Your priority should always be normal -> veterans -> blitzer.

Difficulty: Easy-Hard, Depends on RNG
IF YOU ARE WORRIED ABOUT DYING, PLACE PPR HERE AND GO GRAB DRAGON'S PASSAGE WAYPOINT
Summons one of three champions (Punisher, Stalker, Sniper)
Punisher is the easiest, just stick to his back and don't get hit by his slam
Stalker is also pretty easy as long as you have range. If you do, you can just kite them around in circles. His moves do a lot of damage if you get caught in them, so don't
Sniper is hard, either needing a very tanky build, distractions (pets/minions/etc), projectile hate, or a lot of evades. Melee is not advised, as his kick move does a lot of damage. Honestly, if you get sniper, I recommend just skipping and trying again later
Additional adds are spawned every 25%. If you are unlucky, one of them will be a Desolator, which is invicible most the time and does a jump slam attack that does a lot of damage. Also CC does nothing to them, so you have to just run around and wait for them to go vulnerable. Good luck!
Grab crystal then mount back up. Crystal will prevent mobs from attacking you while you commune
You've finished Teh's Trails HoT Hero Points! Well done!

This is the start of the Teh's Trails HoT Hero Point trail!
While you don't have to follow this specific map order, the intended order is: VB -> AB -> TD
(Press F to flip to the next page)
Double Dodge -> Bond of Vigor -> Double Dodge -> Bond of Faith
Place Jade WP. If it's on cooldown or something, you can always just fly back up here from Shipwreck Peak later.
Small dive
Next HP is a [Easy] combat HP. If you don't want to do it, teleport back to your Jade WP after communing. Otherwise, take Wallow back up

Difficulty: Easy
Will spawn 5 Mordrem - 1 Veteran and 4 Normal.
Kill all normal Mordrem first, then focus on the Veteran last. Adrenal Mushrooms (arrows) can be used to reset all skill CD's if you ever get in danger. Pretty easy by HoT standards.
Afterwards, Teleport to Jade WP

Difficulty: Medium-Hard
Spawns a Champion Golem and Heal-o-trons. Heal-o-trons should always be focused first. Summons/Pets/Minions and Ranged recommended. CC is a plus. Generally, try to stay out of melee range and kite. Try to save dodges for his hand pull, the animation is very obvious. If you have more than one player, you can sit on arrows to do free damage.
Dismount and glide down, dont try to land with mount

Difficulty: Easy because WP is right there to retry from
Before spawning, kill all wasps!
Spawns 1 Champion frog and 2 normals. Ranged is HIGHLY recommended. CC not too important.
Precast summons if you have any. Immediately focus the normals, they hit like TRUCKS. The champion alone is not a huge threat as he mostly stays melee and is easy to kite. Once normals are dead, it's just a matter of chipping away the Champ down. Do not fight him melee range and do you very best to not get hit by his dagger combo.

Yes, I intentionally left out Guano...For one, it's a pain to get to unless choppers are up.
For two, I know a majority of people won't be able to solo it. If you want to get it, feel free to wait till choppers are up and go for it.

This is the start of the Teh's Trails PoF Hero Point trail!
While you don't have to follow this specific map order, the intended order is: CO -> DS -> ER -> TD
(Press F to flip to next page)
If casino event is going on, do yourself a favor and just wait until it's over to start. Water balloon kids are a pain in the butt.
Place Jade Waypoint
Teleport to Jade Waypoint
If gate is closed, bond of faith over it
Small dive here, just try to get as much height as you can and try to get over the cliff

This guy is really annoying as he does a big slam that will knock you off the edge. Recommend: - Stability - Hard CC (You can start on springer and cannonball him for extra CC) - If you class has a portal, you can place one on the platform before you start it and use it if you get knocked off

Check your Jade WP cooldown.
If you have more than 90s left, you should go to Palace of Kormir and go do the other maps, then come back afterwards
If no bond of vigor, bunny to fill endurance then beetle
Be ready to switch to skyscale immediatle after portal, before plant bois hit you
Swap quick!

Place Jade Waypoint
If you're on a fast pace, there's a chance it's on cooldown still from CO. If it is, you'll just have to wait for it to go off CD. Shouldn't be long, go grab a snack quick!
Teleport to Jade WP
DH done! Waypoint back to Temple of Kormir in CO to continue
If you're too slow or don't have stealth, just follow the trail backwards
If no Bond of Vigor, Springer to fill endurance then beetle
If no Bond of Vigor, Springer to fill endurance then beetle
Tehs Trails - PoF HP's complete! Well done!
Make sure to double dodge to get more height
Waypoint back to Arborstone to continue the trail
It's important that you don't mess this dive up. Recommend placing a PPR mark here just in case you bonk your head
TEW Done! Go to whichever waypoint you have unlocked. Order of preference: â¢ Jade Quarry Waypoint â¢ Jade Gate Waypoint â¢ Mori Village Waypoint

If you do not have any of the following waypoints you need to PPR and unlock Mori Village waypoint, then you can continue on the path: â¢ Jade Quarry Waypoint â¢ Jade Gate Waypoint â¢ Mori Village Waypoint
Teh's Trails EoD Hero Points complete! Well done!
If event happening, stealth-commune
Go through the portal to start the TEW HP Trail

This is the start of the Teh's Trails EoD Hero Point trail!
While you don't have to follow this specific map order, the intended order is: NKC -> SP -> TEW -> DE
(Press F to flip to next page)
